summary: METHODS Sampling Site Selection In this pilot study, we gained permission from collaborating institutions to study patient waiting areas in a busy pediatric hospital, a busy public primary care clinic, and a private primary care clinic. we ran 2 types of aerosol samplers during busy patient activity periods (morning and afternoon sessions) 1 day each week for 4 weeks. tetrafluoroethylene (PTFE) Teflon filter cassettes were prewetted with 100 L isopropanol. the pump was set at a flow rate of 5 L/min for 180 minutes. each filter was removed and swabbed with a flocked swab prewetted with sterile virus collection medium. RT-PCR was performed using the SuperScript III Platinum One-Step RT-PCR System with Platinum Taq DNA Polymerase (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Inc.) for influenza A- and influenza B-positive specimens, 200 L of concentrated positive samples were inoculated into MDCK cells with Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM). positive PCR bands were purified using gel-based screening PCR targeting the hexon gene [15]. adenovirus-positive samples were inoculated into a 549 cells with DMEM 2% (v/v) fetal bovine serum and incubated at 37°C for 7 days. adenovirus-positive samples were inoculated into
